titlestmt.titleproper: Graduate Studies, Arts and Sciences records 1932-1987
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: Graduate Studies, Arts and Sciences records

bioghist.p: Villanova University traces its origins to old Saint Augustine's Church in Philadelphia, which the Augustinians founded in 1796, and to its parish school, Saint Augustine's Academy, established in 1811. Villanova University has been sponsored by the Augustinian Order since its founding in 1842. Today, the University is comprised of five colleges: Liberal Arts and Sciences (Villanova College), Engineering, School of Business (formerly known as the College of Commerce and Finance), Nursing and the School of Law. The Graduate Studies Program of the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences offers over 50 programs, from master's degrees to pre- and post-master's certificates, and a Ph.D. in Philosophy.

scopecontent.p: This is a small collection of papers of the Dean of Graduate Studies of Villanova University. Materials consist of administrative records, correspondence, minutes, printed materials, and reports. Administrative records include teacher evaluation questionnaires, graduate enrollment statistics, and a 1967-1968 faculty roster. There is a small amount of correspondence related to the graduate school. Minutes are present for meetings of Graduate Council and other committees involved in graduate studies. Printed materials include brochures and directories. Reports include degrees awarded, graduate enrollment statistics, and self-evaluations of the Graduate School.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
